story.label: Our Story
story.title: Two Worlds, One Heart
story.paragraph1: From the vibrant streets of Mexico City to the cobbled squares of Brussels, our story is a map of two cultures finding a home in one another.
story.paragraph2: We chose France as our gathering place—a neutral ground of beauty and wine—to celebrate the blending of our families and the beginning of our forever.

travel.label: Travel & Stay
travel.title: Accommodation
travel.subtitle: Vallesvilles is a rural village in the Toulouse countryside with approximately 500 inhabitants. This charming village offers a peaceful and authentic setting, typical of the Lauragais region, with its hillsides, open fields, and pretty brick houses. The atmosphere is gentle and welcoming, ideal for hosting a wedding surrounded by nature, far from the hustle and bustle, yet easily accessible from Toulouse.
travel.transportNote: If you are not providing your own transportation to and from the venue, we strongly recommend staying in Toulouse, only a 35 minute drive away, so we can help organize transportation for you.
travel.onsiteDescription: We're delighted to offer limited on-site accommodation at the château for our guests. Priority will be given to immediate family members.

faq.label: Questions & Answers
faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: Everything you need to know about our wedding celebration in France.
faq.contactNote: Still have questions? Feel free to reach out to us directly—we're happy to help!

welcomeDinner.title: Welcome Dinner
welcomeDinner.description: Think elegant but not overly formal. For women, a cocktail dress, jumpsuit, or dressy separates work beautifully. For men, a suit or blazer paired with dress pants. Feel free to add a pop of color!

wedding.title: The Wedding
wedding.description: This is our most elegant celebration. For women, floor-length gowns, formal midi dresses, or elegant cocktail dresses are perfect. For men, a dark suit or tuxedo. Think black-tie optional.

brunch.title: Farewell Brunch
brunch.description: Relaxed but polished. Sundresses, linen separates, chinos with a nice shirt, or a casual blazer all work well. Comfortable and chic!

dressCode.shoeTip: The ceremony and reception will be outdoors on grass and gravel paths, so we recommend comfortable shoes—block heels or wedges are great alternatives to stilettos.

items.question: When and where is the wedding?
items.answer: Our wedding will take place on August 26, 2026 at Vallesvilles, France. The ceremony will begin mid-afternoon, with a specific time to follow in your invitation.

items.question: Can I bring a plus one?
items.answer: Yes, you are welcome to bring a plus one! Please indicate their name on your RSVP form. If you're unsure whether your invitation includes a plus one, please reach out to us.

items.question: Are children welcome?
items.answer: Yes, children are welcome at our celebration! Please indicate any children attending on your RSVP form so we can make appropriate arrangements.

items.question: What are the transportation options?
items.answer: The nearest major airport is Toulouse-Blagnac (TLS), approximately 45 minutes from the venue. We recommend renting a car or arranging a taxi. We will provide more detailed transportation information closer to the date.

items.question: Will there be vegetarian or special dietary options?
items.answer: Yes! Please indicate any dietary requirements on your RSVP form, and we'll ensure there are delicious options for you.

items.question: What time should I arrive?
items.answer: We recommend arriving 15-30 minutes before each event begins to find your seat and settle in.

items.question: Can I take photos during the ceremony?
items.answer: We kindly ask for an unplugged ceremony—please keep phones and cameras away during the ceremony so you can be fully present. Our photographer will capture all the special moments!

items.question: Is there parking at the venue?
items.answer: Yes, there is free parking available at the venue. Parking attendants will guide you upon arrival.

items.question: When do I need to RSVP by?
items.answer: Please respond by February 1, 2026 so we can finalize arrangements with our vendors.
